image.altText: Water splashing into a hand under a water tap. Water tank in the background.

props.synopsis: With many rainwater tanks across the Adelaide Hills running low or on empty due to an ongoing dry spell, two residents say thieves have used water trucks to steal nearly 200,000 litres overnight.

title.children: Nearly 200,000 litres of water stolen from Adelaide Hills tanks, residents say

image.altText: Bianca Feher sings into a microphone and plays her guitar wearing a green shirt. Tin sheets and bush are behind her.

props.synopsis: South Australia and New South Wales have introduced grassroots music programs to revitalise a struggling regional live music industry, and new research backs their initiatives.

title.children: Live music programs giving regional artists something to sing about

image.altText: Scott de Bruin holding a large tomahawk wagyu cut.

props.synopsis: Australia's wagyu beef industry is poised for export growth amid America's falling beef herd numbers and continued demand for Australia's premium meat in global markets.

title.children: Wagyu beef producer confident about exports despite Trump tariff threat

image.altText: The remains of a large puffed up globe fish sit on the sand of a surf beach.

props.synopsis: As sharks, rays, and other marine life continue to wash up on South Australian beaches, citizen scientists are urged to record the scale of the lingering marine algal bloom event.

title.children: Citizen scientists needed to help sea life amid algal bloom devastation

image.altText: A pair of utes parked near a road train in the outback.

props.synopsis: With charging infrastructure scant and the capabilities of hybrid utes not fully tested, outback communities are likely to keep relying on diesel vehicles for some time, experts say.

title.children: Outback hybrid sales strong, but diesel 4WDs unlikely to be replaced

image.altText: Four people walking amongst streets with new builds behind them

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton prepare for a sprint to the election finish line, some South Australians could be questioning if their state is part of the race.

title.children: Does South Australia matter this federal election?

image.altText: A black and white dairy cow looks up from its trough of feed

props.synopsis: The South Australian government provides $3 million in support for dairy farmers affected by the collapse of Beston Global Food.

title.children: $3m lifeline for dairy farmers out of pocket as processor liquidated

image.altText: Missing man Michael Jeffrey Purse.

props.synopsis: Family members of murder victim Michael Purse have labelled his remorseless killer a cruel and evil coward who "does not belong in society", and say they do not have much hope his body will ever be found.

title.children: Murder victim's mum labels son's killer 'small, insignificant coward'

image.altText: Raw lamb chops.

props.synopsis: China grants access to more Australian lamb and mutton as it looks for other markets during the trade war with US President Donald Trump.

title.children: More Aussie sheep meat will be sent to China as trade wars continue

image.altText: The central business district of Port Augusta with wind turbines in the distance.

props.synopsis: Port Augusta is one of seven locations across the country earmarked to host nuclear power plants if the Coalition wins the federal election, but the community has mixed views on the proposal.

title.children: Nuclear power is earmarked for Port Augusta, but reactions are mixed

image.altText: Vote Compass Gen Z

props.synopsis: Experts say young women are a "really important" voting category but are sometimes "not recognised", as Vote Compass data shows gen Z females to be deeply progressive.

title.children: 'Not recognised': What politicians don't get about young women

image.altText: sign

props.synopsis: The Plymouth Brethren Christian Church denies organising volunteers for Coalition campaigns, but says members are free to volunteer on their own.

title.children: Calls for clarity over fringe Christian sect backing Coalition campaign

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Victorian prosecutors drop some of the charges against Ms Patterson, as the 50-year-old's Supreme Court murder trial gets under way in the regional town of Morwell.

title.children: Accused triple-murderer Erin Patterson no longer facing charges over ex-husband

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in front of gold curtains.

props.synopsis: April 29 marks day 100 of Donald Trump's extraordinarily eventful second term as US president. Here's some of what you might have missed.

title.children: What Trump's first 100 days say about the days to come

image.altText: Black seats with yellow signs and hats sitting on them waiting for a crow. The sign says: VOTE 1 TRUMPET OF PATRIOTS.

props.synopsis: With polls indicating the Coalition may need preferences from right-leaning candidates to secure key seats, Trumpet of Patriots and One Nation could play a decisive role in how the election plays out.

title.children: Make Australia great again? Hanson and Palmer hitch to the Trump bandwagon

image.altText: white man with greying hair and beard in chain and black top with arm tattoos smiles at camera with arms crossed

props.synopsis: Former NSW CFMEU leaders Darren Greenfield and son Michael reach a plea deal with prosecutors.

title.children: Former NSW union boss and his son plead guilty to corruption, bribery charges

image.altText: Kim Williams speaking at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Kim Williams has denied interfering in editorial decision-making in order to secure airtime for an Australian comedian.

title.children: ABC chair denies interference over comedian interviews

image.altText: A grapic depicting a computer infected with malware for a story about stolen banking passwords.

props.synopsis: The banking passwords of tens of of thousands of Australians have been stolen using malware and traded online by cybercriminals, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Banking passwords stolen from thousands of Australians and traded online

image.altText: Group of women take selfie with Albanese

props.synopsis: Across the country candidates are making their case for how they can put a lid on the rising cost of everything, but if the cost-of-living debate shows anything this election, it’s just how many people still feel forgotten.

title.children: The cost-of-living debate this election shows how many people are being left behind

image.altText: Three Aboriginal candidates stand wearing campaign shirts

props.synopsis: Twenty-year-old Barkandji woman Laylah Al-Saimary is running for the Senate this federal election. She’s a member of the first all-Indigenous party in Australia's history.

title.children: 'The river is our mother': Meet the all-Indigenous political party

image.altText: Jamrra Ugle-Hagan walks off the ground

props.synopsis: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan takes a leave of absence from the Western Bulldogs as he deals with personal issues.

title.children: Ugle-Hagan takes indefinite personal leave from Bulldogs

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob, smiling alongside her young family.

props.synopsis: The drug, given as an injection under the skin, combines fragments of a protein found in the beta cells of people with type 1 diabetes and vitamin D to calm the immune response.

title.children: World-first drug trial could reprogram immune system

image.altText: Sign for Brisbane's court precinct, pointing to the Magistrates, District and Supreme Courts.

props.synopsis: A court has heard how the mother of a woman, whose dead body was left on a Brisbane apartment verandah for months, was allegedly tricked into sending hundreds of thousands of dollars to her alleged killer.

title.children: Mum was allegedly tricked into sending money to man charged with daughter's murder

image.altText: Helmer in Tierralta.

props.synopsis: Decades of violence have left over a hundred thousand missing in Colombia. The country has made it its mission to find them.

title.children: Helmer spent just 3 months in jail for each of the people he killed

image.altText: Juvenile handfish in an enclosure

props.synopsis: The big moment of releasing a group of juvenile spotted handfish into the wild has arrived — and to help them adjust, researchers have built little underwater "hotels" for the young fish.

title.children: Underwater 'hotels' in place to give tiny endangered species a helping hand

image.altText: police officer speaks to members of the public outside a train station in madrid

props.synopsis: Traffic was gridlocked, trains stopped working, people were stuck in lifts and nuclear power stations were automatically shut down as a blackout hit tens of millions of people across Spain and Portugal.

title.children: Spanish network lost 15 gigawatts in five seconds before power outage

image.altText: A man giving a dodgy look to the camera

props.synopsis: A new coalition of Solomon Islands MPs that includes former prime minister Manasseh Sogavare says it has the numbers to oust the country's sitting prime minister, with a vote of no confidence set for next week.

title.children: 'Master of mayhem': Former Solomon Islands PM in surprise plot to remove leader

image.altText: The pope, dressed in white robes and a hat, pushes against a large ornate brass door.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Catholic faithful are expected to descend upon Rome in the coming weeks — and not only to mourn Pope Francis.

title.children: Why it matters that the pope died in a Jubilee year

image.altText: an f/18 super hornet fighter jet sits on top of a us navy aircraft carrier ship

props.synopsis: As sailors were towing the aircraft into place in the hangar bay of the USS Harry S Truman, they lost control and it went overboard.

title.children: F-18 jet fighter slips off deck of US aircraft carrier deployed to Red Sea

props.synopsis: One of the most highly anticipated murder trials in recent memory is about to begin in regional Victoria. Erin Patterson is accused of murdering three people and attempting to murder another after serving up a Beef Wellington allegedly laced with lethal death cap mushrooms.

title.children: Erin Patterson’s mushroom murder trial begins

image.altText: Josh Sinn's head hits the ground in a tackle by Paul Curtis

props.synopsis: North Melbourne's Paul Curtis remains suspended for three matches after losing his challenge to a rough conduct charge at the AFL tribunal.

title.children: Curtis fails to overturn three-game dangerous tackle ban

image.altText: A man standing with a sliding door slightly open looks at the camera as a woman stands in front of him.

props.synopsis: The former operator of a Sydney childcare centre where children were force-fed until they vomited, strapped in highchairs for hours and had their heads shoved into garbage bins, has been permanently banned from working in the disability support sector.

title.children: NDIS provider shut down following ABC childcare investigation

image.altText: An exterior sign says 'Only About Children - More Than Childcare'.

props.synopsis: When a parent drops their child at their local Only About Children childcare centre in Sydney or Melbourne, they probably don't know the revenue will be cheered on the New York Stock Exchange, writes Conor Duffy.

title.children: US fund managers cut corners at Australian daycares for bigger profits

image.altText: Max Purcell smiles during a press conference

props.synopsis: Two-time grand slam doubles champion Max Purcell accepts an 18-month doping ban from the International Tennis Integrity Agency.

title.children: 'So glad this is finally over': Doubles champ Purcell accepts 18-month doping ban

image.altText: Yayoi Kusama, with bright red hair, smiles and waves seated at bench covered in vibrant coloured prints also in background.

props.synopsis: Financial support for artists, local content quotas for streaming platforms and AI regulation are on the agenda this election.

title.children: Arts is a $64 billion industry — so why aren't the leaders talking about it?
